name: Blockworks Daily
title: Utf8b8jfqg Friday Anticipatory Charts
text:
Synopsis
Markets remain surprisingly calm despite potential economic and political risks, with the S&P 500 at record highs, suggesting either market resilience or a potential underestimation of emerging threats.

Key Insights
- New tariffs on aluminum and steel could potentially "throttle American industry and fragment global markets"
- A Standard Chartered report estimates two-thirds of US jobs added last year were filled by undocumented migrants, suggesting significant labor market vulnerability
- US imports from China have declined from nearly 25% to 13% over the past decade
- The Global Economic Policy Uncertainty Index is near an all-time high
- Gold continues to make new highs, up 10% this year, potentially signaling underlying market concerns
- Job openings for software developers are continuing to fall
- NASA data suggests a 2% chance of an asteroid hitting Earth in 2032
- Two-year inflation expectations have decoupled from gas prices, potentially indicating "unanchored inflation"
- Previous steel tariffs resulted in US steel producers adding 1,000 jobs but steel consumers cutting 75,000 jobs
